definition: to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲

sentences.english: It's going to be perhaps a lot murkier.
The relationship between Medvedev and Putin remains something of a mystery.
sentences.chinese: 梅德韦杰夫和普京之间的关系依然有些扑朔迷离。

sentences.english: Esthetics question is in the philosophy domain one of most confusing questions.
sentences.chinese: 美学问题是哲学领域中最扑朔迷离的问题之一。

definition: a haze of doubts and suspicions
thought-provoking/worth thinking over/to provide food for thought
lit. to look at flowers in the fog (idiom); fig. blurred vision
hard to distinguish real from imitation
pending a decision/hanging in the balance
what is true and what is fake
the mountain road twists around each new peak (idiom)/(of a mountain road) twisting and turning/fig. an opportunity has come unexpectedly/things have taken a new turn
see 謎兒|谜儿[mei4 r5], riddle
calligraphic flourish with many twists/fig. many twists and turns
